Reviewing a User’s Group Memberships

A user can be a member of more than one group. Users who belong to multiple groups can perform operations at the highest level permitted by any of their group privileges.

Membership in a group can be explicit, implicit, or both. A user has explicit membership in a group when:

  • The group was selected at the time the user's account was created.

  • The user’s name was dragged to the group (in the application).

  • The user’s name was selected from the Group Membership dialog in the Server Administration utility.

Users can have implicit membership as a result of the group hierarchy. If a user is a member of a child group, he or she is also a member of the parent group, even if the user’s name does not directly appear in the list for the parent group.

Note: This function can be performed only for servers that are currently running.

To review a user’s group memberships:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane.  If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the User Manager shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > User Manager.

    The User Manager dialog opens. By default, the All Users group is selected, so all user names are shown in the Users pane.

  4. Select the user's name in the Users pane.

  5. Right-click to open the context menu, and select Group Membership. This action allows you to review a list of groups to which the user belongs.

  6. Click OK.

To add a user to additional groups, see Adding Users.
